name: Rotating|Buying SSL certificates .txt - Steps to rotate/buy Public Signed Certificates
description: This section explains the steps to generate or rotate SSL certificates for a domain. It covers generating a Certificate Signing Request (CSR), obtaining the certificate files from the IT team, creating a .pfx file, converting it to base64, storing the certificate and password in a secure credential store (credstash), generating a public key from the certificate, and updating the credentials and rotating the application pods.
use_cases: Obtaining a new SSL certificate for a domain
Rotating or renewing an existing SSL certificate
Securely storing and managing SSL certificates and credentials

name: Rotating|Buying SSL certificates .txt - Steps to rotate Self Signed Certificates
description: This section explains the steps to rotate or renew self-signed SSL certificates, which are used to secure communication between a web server and clients. It provides a command to generate a new private key and certificate signing request (CSR), and instructions to submit the CSR to the IT team for obtaining a new SSL certificate. The process ensures that the website or application maintains a valid SSL certificate, which is crucial for secure data transmission and establishing trust with users.
use_cases: Renewing or rotating self-signed SSL certificates
Securing communication between a web server and clients
Obtaining a new SSL certificate from the IT team
Maintaining a valid SSL certificate for a website or application
capabilities: Providing subject information for SSL certificate
Specifying domain URL for SSL certificate
